column1: Data Export Generated on Wed Jul 07 03:44:14 PDT 2021

column19: Hi there! Thank you very much for your time.We really appreciate it. Please please help us understand corporate behavior answering this short survey. We'd love to pay you for completing this task and will surely do it as long as you answer to the best of your knowledge. We know you will answer in this fashion as you are too cool to answer in a rush or not paying attention to the questions ;)
column20: Consent Form1.      What is the study about?You are invited to participate in a study of consumer behavior. We hope to learn how companies are perceivedby consumers after they engage in certain kinds of corporate behavior. Our intention is to understand someof the factors that influence these perceptions. To gain insights on these perceptions multiple-choice questionswill be asked about certain aspects of the behavior of the companies.Answers will then be analyzed to gain insights on how consumers perceive the companies.2.       Do I have to participate?Being part of this study is voluntary. If you want to be part of the study we ask that you read the information below carefully.You can read the information below and decide at the end if you do not want to participate.  3.       Who is being asked to participate?You have been asked to participate because:·         You are part of a society where contact with organizations is frequent. 4.       What will I be asked to do?If you want to take part in this study we will ask you to read a short vignette (or a set of them) and answer a short questionnaireregarding it (them). It will take around 10 minutes of your time to be part of this study. You will receive a compensation of 0.4 after completing the survey in its totality.5.       What are the benefits?The benefit of you taking part in this study is that you will contribute to research on consumer behavior. The expected benefits to society in general are a better understanding of how consumers think about organizations. 6.       What are the risks?With any study there are (1) risks we know about (2) risks we don’t know about and (3) risks we don’t expect.If you experience something that you aren’t sure about please contact us immediately so we can discuss the best way to manage your concerns.           Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co       We have listed the risks we know about below. This will help you decide if you want to be part of the study.·         You can experience some distress upon reading the description of the scenario(s).7.       What will happen to information about me?By clicking on the ‘I agree start questionnaire’ button this tells us you want to take part in the study.We will collect information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are.We will store information about you in ways that will not reveal who you are. We will publish information about you in ways that will not be identified in any type of publication from this study.We will keep your information indefinitely after the project is completed and might use it for future related projects.The data will be available publicly so that other researchers can replicate the findings.  Notice that no personal information that can identify you will be collected in this study. The personal information you provide will be handled in accordance with applicable privacy laws any health information collected will be handled in accordance with the Health Records Act 2001 (Vic). Subject to any exceptions in relevant laws you have the right to access and correct your personal information by contacting the research team.8.       Will I hear about the results of the study?We will let you know about the results of the study by email upon request to the principal investigator. Please consider that it can take several months before this research is published.9.       What if I change my mind?If you no longer want to complete the questionnaire simply close the web browser.If you change your mind after clicking on the ‘Submit’ button we cannot withdraw your responses because we cannot link who you are with your questionnaire responses. 10.    Who can I contact for questions or want more information?If you would like to speak to us please use the contact details below:Name: Luis Arango Email: laarangoso@unal.edu.co  Consent Form –Declaration by ParticipantI (the participant) have read understood the Participant Information Statement and any questions have been answered to my satisfaction. I agree to participate in the study I know I cannot withdraw my responses following the collection of my data but that I can abandon the survey at any point during the completion of it. I agree information provided by me or with my permission during the project may be included in a thesis presentation and published in journals on the condition that I cannot be identified. I also understand that my responses to the questionnaire will be part of a data set that will be publicly available and that the dataset can be used for any future studies.If you wish to receive a copy of the study results you can request it by contacting Mr Luis Alfredo Arango at laarangoso@unal.edu.co. The results are expected to be available around November 2022. This long period is due to the duration of academic journals’ peer-review processes.
column24: What is your highest degree or level of school you have completed?
column27: Please read carefully the following scenario as ALL the questions make reference to it:  Crimson One is a very small foreign construction business that builds residential properties. The business has around 30 employees. Crimson One has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However several house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column29: Crimson One is a small business.
column31: What do you think about the behavior of Crimson?
column32: You will be presented with some statements. Please choose your level of agreement with the statements using the options given.
column33: Here is a reminder of the scenario in case you need it. Please take into account that all the questions will make reference to it:   Crimson One is a very small foreign construction business that builds residential properties. The business has around 30 employees. Crimson One has been operating for over ten years and its financial situation is very good. One day Crimson One owners decide to increase their profits by employing cheaper materials to construct houses in low-income suburbs where it can go unnoticed. The strategy is a success for Crimson One and the business owners decide to stick with it. However several house owners and tenants are eventually impacted by the use of cheap materials and they later find themselves spending money on house maintenance and repairs.
column72: Please write a random six digit number (don't be predictable for example 123456" as this would be used to pay you). Please place the same code on Mturk when prompted."

column31: Unethical
I think their behavior is unethical.
I think they dont care about the people they build for.  They just care about money.  If they cared more about the consumers they serve, they would use quality materials.
I think its unethical to use cheaper materials to be able to build houses that arent up to standards. Its OK not to use luxury materials, but its NOT OK to do it on the cheap.
Sounds pretty deceitful. This sort of company should try to increase their profits by obtaining more customers rather than using cheaper materials.
I think their business practices are despicable.

I think that by a business standpoint it was quite lucrative for the company, what the company did. However I feel that they shouldnt have done that because it hurts people and derives them to pay even more for something they couldnt control. Especially when the business was doing fine already.
I dont think they broke the law by using cheap materials but I dont think it is the right thing to do. I dont like them.
I think its in line with the kind of behavior thats to be expected from most corporations. They know they can get away with using sub-par materials, so they do.
It is irresponsible and unfair to customers to use cheaper materials.
They are doing what is best for the company to make profits. I have no strong opinion either way.
I think what Crimson did is unethical and morally questionable. At the same time, I dont think they did anything illegal.

I can understand wanting to make more of a profit, however, this is not the way to do it.  The company was good financially but this move to use cheaper materials is going to ruin their reputation and affect their bottom line.  This is a very deceptive practice on their part unless they mark the house price down and then they are not making the additional profits.  I would quickly go back to the way they did business before and scrap this plan.
It is unethical and unprofessional. I would like for them to revert back to their old ways.
It is unprofessional and unethical.
it is despicable and they should be fined or punished some way.
They are exploiting the poor.
Crimson is not behaving in a ethical manner.

Not good.  Recently we had a condo complex just collapse in South Florida.  I imagine that when the investigation is finished, poor construction practices were allowed.  Of the same type in this scenario.
I think it was permitted considering the circumstances of cost and it being a small business
It is typical of a business to cut costs at the expense of the customers.
I think the behavior of Crimson is morally unacceptable and unethical.
I dont like it. I think it is selfish. I honestly feel bad for the homeowners who were impacted by Crimsons actions. They have to use cheap things and often have to replace them.
I think the behavior is unethical. However, I do not judge Crimson. This is the nature of capitalism.
Its repulsive but its what I expect from businesses that are focused on nothing but maximizing profits and dont care about the quality of the product they produce.

I think Crimsons behavior, while good from a profits point of view, is morally despicable, because they are essentially taking advantage of the people in lower-income suburbs that cannot do anything about the cheaper houses that Crimson made for them. I think its very unfair that the lower income people are treated as less-than and that they are essentially being bullied with the cheap quality housing.
Although the strategy of using cheaper material was working, they should switch to better construction material so that property owners can have more durable better home to live in.
I think its unprofessional and also unethical.
I think this is bad behavior that shows they dont care about their customers.

It is very unethical. The company is taking advantage of lower-income individuals,  thinking these people wont notice the cheap materials they used on their homes. I think the company looks down on the lower class individuals. I think they are manipulate, and look down on the little guy. Very unethical company, exploiting others for their own benefits.
I think it was wholly irresponsible to skirt the rules and use cheap materials.
I think it is terrible that it made low income houses with cheaper material.
I think their behavior is reprehensible. That they decided to pick low-income areas to build homes of substandard quality is a horrible, immoral thing to do.
I think that is bad business practice.
I think its immoral and appalling
Despicable to make other peoples lives harder to save a few bucks. It is dangerous, immoral behavior.
Its underhanded. Its very wrong
I feel the behavior of crimson is not moral.
I think the behavior is unethical and they should be punished.
unethical, makes lower income people pay in the future for maintenance and repairs because of cheap materials used by Crimson One

The behavior to use cheaper materials for the sake of higher profits is unethical and wrong. This will damage their reputation among its customers which in turn can have a negative effect on its business..
Crimson One undermined the safety and stability of their customers by using cheap materials to make their houses, just to make a profit.
I do not appreciate the business practices of Crimson One. Using cheaper materials because they thought that it would not be noticed in low income suburbs is not a good business practice.
Their behavior is unethical and dangerous.
I think it’s crappy but such a common practice. Companies love to produce goods with cheap materials and charge as much as they would for quality ones, thus expanding their profit margins.
dishonest
I believe that companys behavior is typical of a company of this type but wish that quality could be the focus over profits.
Greedy and disgusting
it is very bad and morally wrong
I think its unethical.
It is reprehensible and immoral.
I think that it is unfortunate that they choose to take that action and not worry about how it would effect lower income famillies.
I think it is an underhanded way to increase profits. I dont think it is good behavior.
Sounds like they deserve what is coming to them. Do shoddy work, get shoddy results. I dont think Crimson is a very good company.
Its unethical and immoral to use cheap materials that can impact low income individuals or anyone in the community for a profit.

I think it was human nature but greedy for them to use cheaper materials to increase profits. I understand why but think that it was a low move, as it decreased the quality of their company that was already successful.
I think they cut corners to save money and it caused homeowners alot of problems
I think their purchase of cheap materials is not fair to the consumer.
I think that they should avoid cutting corners when it comes at the cost of potentially harming individuals.
It is very unethical.
it was unethical
I think it was inappropriate to cut corners just because they thought it would go unnoticed.
They behaved unethically by using shoddy building materials.
I think that this is not ethical and Crimson One is being very greedy and evil by doing this.
I think their behavior is absolutely deplorable and makes me angry to think about. Even though this is a fictional company, many people do things like this and target low income people.

It is not responsible at all, cutting corners and using cheap material can cost lives, also the owners have to spend a lot of money to maintain the property because the material used to build them was cheap.

They should have used the same standard of safe materials in all of the houses. If they wanted to cut costs, I would understand using cheaper materials, but not to the extend that the homes have issues.
Its unethical and immoral.
It is immoral.
They did what a lot of businesses do...cut corners tomsave money
This is not ethical behavior.  Adequate materials should be use for housing, low-rent or not.
It sounds predatory. They are trying to make more money at the expense of people who are already living in certain neighborhoods or who might move there.

I think this company is greatly taking advantage of the low income neighborhood where Crimson is using cheaper materials to construct houses because Crimson thinks it will go unnoticed. Shame on Crimson.
I think it is unethical and wrong. They are taking advantage of lower-income families and reaping the benefits, while those families are suffering with increased maintenance costs.
sen it happen, so greedy

Its not how I would choose to run a business.  Id rather have lower profits and a job done right, but I also understand that some businesses choose to operate in this way.  Makes me shake my head a bit at them.

I think that the behavior of Crimson is really unsatisfying but satisfying at the same time, if cheap material is used to build those houses then the rent or buying the property could be a little cheaper. However, using cheap materials could bring future damage to property and people living in it
I think for a small business it operates a lot like a cost cutting corporation, with zero interest in being good to customers.

I think that Crimsons behavior is highly unethical and wrong due to the fact that they knowingly endangered the safety and wellbeing of people who purchased their homes. There is no justification for their actions and I believe that they are deserving of censure and punishment for what they did.
Reprehensible. I think it is totally irresponsible. The owners of Crimson should be ashamed at the way they decided to do business.
It seems like they are a cheap business that wants to make more profits than benefit others or produce quality craftsmanship.
theyre an average company with average behavior typical of other companies similar to them
Its bad business and morally wrong. Theyre driven solely by profits and dont care about their customers.
It is a very unethical company with unfair practices.
I think the behavior of Crimson is unacceptable. It had caused problems for the buyers of the properties that the built.

I think it is probably common, but completely unethical. I know people cut corners to save money, but the fact that it impacted other people in a negative way they couldnt afford isnt right. The business should be punished for poor building standards.
It is an unethical business practice.  I feel like their company is not trustworthy by using subpar materials.  I would not trust them to build a house for me.
It was a bad gamble and now their reputation will take a hit
I think they should use higher quality materials instead of cheaper ones. I think it is somewhat evil to do that to their customers considering they will have to pay more for repairs.
I think that it is wrong and immoral.
I understand that the company is trying to make the most profit but I think it is unethical and irresponsible to use low quality materials just to earn extra money. This is dangerous.
It is very discriminatory and unethical, possibly even illegal.
I don’t find it very fair to give consumers very cheap materials to build their houses when it gives them a financial gain. This is morally and ethically wrong in my personal opinion.
It is reprehensible to take advantage of people who have a harder time affording repairs of this shoddy construction work.

I think they made a poor choice by deciding to use cheaper materials, which save them money, but just lead to problems down the road.  They sacrificed quality and their reputation, just so they could make more money.
They are skirting the boundaries of ethical but probably not doing anything illegal.
I think it is appropriate
I think that their decision to use cheaper materials and thus cause issues for tenants later down the line is immoral, unethical, and greedy.
I think it was morally wrong to cheapen the products because they cheapen their business when they do that.

I think Crimsons behavior is typical and okay as long as the repairs needed to cause any harm to the people living there (e.g. by using lead-based paint or ceilings collapsing on others). As long as the prices of the houses in lower-income neighborhoods reflected the cheaper materials (i.e. they didnt price gauge) then I think its reasonable to expect slightly lower quality for cheaper products, including houses, like cheaper jeans are not as high quality as more expensive jeans.
Crimson one is construction company and small business builds residential properties.
I think it is wrong I think quality should be very important to a business .
Crimson bussiness is construction business.

I think they were wrong for using cheaper materials to benefit themselves. A lot of people were depending on a decent home to last a long time, and now they are out their money repairing things, in my opinion. I wouldnt want purchase anything from this company.
I believe if they are going to use cheap materials they should use them on all their jobs. The customer can choose to employ them. Only using on low income is unacceptable.
Crimson One’s behavior is sneaky and they are cutting corners so they can make a bigger profit.
I believe they were unethical in using substandard materials to build lower income homes in order to save money.
They have a behavior focused on profits. They dont mind affecting others.
They are very unethical and have a bad business practice.
It seems unethical
It is immoral and should be illegal.

I think this kind of business practice generally comes back to bite you in the end with increased upkeep costs. One of the best places to skimp are often on purely decorative items like drawer pulls, wall paint, etc. I think this is pretty common business practice but not a wise one in the long run, and is unethical.
I think Crimson One is unethical and should have their licensing revoked. They should be held accountable by the home owners for their immoral use of building materials that were subpar.
Criminal, deceptive, dangerous, unethical, unprofessional, brings disrepute to ethical firms
I find it unethical and shady, I think Crimson should be held accountable and have to pay for the repairs on the homes.
I think they are wrong for using cheaper materials.  Very immoral behavior.
They are selfish and only thinking about momentary gain instead of long-term
I think they are cheap and want to make profits at the expense of the less fortunate.
Very reprehensible.
unethical. they shouldnt cut corners on construction, since it may cost lives
Completely unacceptable.  They are taking advantage of lower income families.
I dislike the companys behavior and would not do business with them in the future.  I would be sure to tell everyone I know about their unethical business practices.

I think that its semi predatorial. On one side, it makes sense that they would need to use cheaper materials to build the property in order for a lower income family or person to afford it, on the other side, they dont really have many alternatives to Crimson One more than likely.
